ground_truth: Dillinger scans the hillside but finds no sign of anyone, as Red peers over his shoulder from his tree. Dillinger relaxes his aim, and both men start off while Winstead lies low behind a tree. In slow motion, the criminals run along the misty overlook with Red leading the way as Agent Hurt opens fire from uphill, bringing Red down. Dillinger urges Red to his feet, and they move on. Behind them, Winstead resumes tracking the pair. Dillinger accosts an average man standing outside a cabin. Later, Red clutches his side, and Dillinger opens the heisted car's door for him. Baby Face reaches an unpaved road, where Baum, driving a car, peers ahead over the steering wheel. Baby Face turns his back to the vehicle as its glaring headlights draw closer and waves a hand low, paces backward, and keeps his Tommy gun under his coat. Baum stops and climbs out the other door. Baby Face throws him down and tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat before getting behind the wheel. As Baum's car drives off, Purvis comes running through the forest, finds his fallen partner, doffs his hat, crouches down to his fading colleague, glaring after the car riding steadily away, and moves out. Agent Madala follows, hesitating upon seeing Baum's body. On the dirt road, Purvis aims loosely at an oncoming car while holding up one hand; it's Cowley's team. Cowley pulls a 180, and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board, armed with his Tommy gun. Baby Face comes upon Homer and Shouse, who aim their guns at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn, and Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road, then the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther ahead, prompting Purvis to fire. Homer returns fire as Baby Face swerves to avoid incoming shots, and Purvis fires relentlessly from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer loads his next round, with a curve in the road giving Purvis an angled shot. Shouse nervously wipes his nose as Purvis tags the Ford's hood, causing the Ford to careen into a field and roll twice before settling on its tires. Shouse's lifeless face leans on the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed front door, but the paunchy gangster kicks it out. Purvis arrives and riddles Homer with bullets, with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. Making an escape, Baby Face nails Cowley, leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol, but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first. Purvis follows up with shots of his own, and the paunchy gangster goes down as Baby Face half recovers, getting to his knees and discharges Tommy rounds.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Dillinger scrutinizes the mountainside but locates no indication of anybody, as Red peers over his shoulder from his tree. Dillinger relaxes his aim, and both men start off while Winstead lies low behind a tree. In slow motion, the outlaws sprint along the foggy overlook with Red leading the path as Agent Hurt opens fire from uphill, bringing Red down. Dillinger urges Red to his feet, and they move on. Behind them, Winstead resumes tracking the duo. Dillinger confronts an average man standing outside a cabin. Later, Red clutches his side, and Dillinger opens the pilfered car's door for him. Baby Face reaches an unpaved lane, where Baum, steering a car, peers ahead over the steering wheel. Baby Face turns his back to the automobile as its glaring headlights draw nearer and waves a hand low, steps backward, and keeps his Tommy gun under his coat. Baum stops and climbs out the other door. Baby Face throws him down and tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat before getting behind the wheel. As Baum's car drives off, Purvis comes sprinting through the woods, finds his fallen partner, doffs his hat, crouches down to his fading colleague, glaring after the car riding steadily away, and moves out. Agent Madala follows, hesitating upon seeing Baum's body. On the dirt road, Purvis aims loosely at an approaching car while holding up one hand; it's Cowley's team. Cowley pulls a 180, and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board, armed with his Tommy gun. Baby Face comes upon Homer and Shouse, who aim their guns at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn, and Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road, then the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther ahead, prompting Purvis to fire. Homer returns fire as Baby Face swerves to avoid incoming shots, and Purvis fires relentlessly from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer loads his next round, with a curve in the road giving Purvis an angled shot. Shouse nervously wipes his nose as Purvis tags the Ford's hood, causing the Ford to swerve into a field and roll twice before settling on its tires. Shouse's lifeless face leans on the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed front door, but the corpulent gangster kicks it out. Purvis arrives and riddles Homer with bullets, with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. Making an escape, Baby Face nails Cowley, leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol, but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first. Purvis follows up with shots of his own, and the corpulent gangster goes down as Baby Face half recovers, getting to his knees and discharges Tommy rounds.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The hillside is scanned by Dillinger, but no sign of anyone is found, as his shoulder is peered over by Red from his tree. The aim is relaxed by Dillinger, and the start is made by both men while Winstead lies low behind a tree. In slow motion, the misty overlook is run along by the criminals with Red leading the way as fire is opened from uphill by Agent Hurt, bringing Red down. Red is urged to his feet by Dillinger, and they move on. The pair is resumed tracking by Winstead behind them. An average man standing outside a cabin is accosted by Dillinger. Later, Red clutches his side, and the heisted car's door is opened by Dillinger for him. An unpaved road is reached by Baby Face, where Baum, driving a car, peers ahead over the steering wheel. The vehicle is turned toward by Baby Face as its glaring headlights draw closer, and he waves a hand low, paces backward, and keeps his Tommy gun under his coat. Baum stops and climbs out the other door. Baum is thrown down by Baby Face, and Baum's Tommy gun is tossed onto the front seat before he gets behind the wheel. As the car drives off, Purvis runs through the forest, finds his fallen partner, doffs his hat, crouches down to his fading colleague, glares after the car riding steadily away, and moves out. Agent Madala follows, hesitating upon seeing Baum's body. Purvis aims loosely at an oncoming car on the dirt road while holding up one hand; it's Cowley's team. A 180 is pulled by Cowley, and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board, armed with his Tommy gun. Homer and Shouse are come upon by Baby Face, who aim their guns at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn, and Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road, then the rise is climbed by the stolen Ford farther ahead, prompting fire to be opened by Purvis. Fire is returned by Homer as shots are avoided by Baby Face’s swerving, and relentless fire is opened by Purvis from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. His next round is loaded by Homer, with a curve in the road giving Purvis an angled shot. His nose is nervously wiped by Shouse as the Ford's hood is tagged by Purvis, causing the Ford to careen into a field and roll twice before settling on its tires. The cracked windshield is leaned on by Shouse’s lifeless face. Baby Face is left stuck behind the jammed front door by Homer, but the door is kicked out by the paunchy gangster. Homer is riddled with bullets by Purvis upon arrival, with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. Cowley is nailed by Baby Face making an escape, leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol, but a shotgun is fired first by Agent Madala. Purvis follows up with shots of his own, and the paunchy gangster is brought down as half of a recovery is made by Baby Face, getting to his knees and discharging Tommy rounds.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Dillinger scans the hillside, finding no one, as Red peers over his shoulder from a tree. Dillinger relaxes his aim, and both men move on while Winstead hides behind a tree. In slow motion, the criminals run along the misty overlook with Red leading as Agent Hurt fires from uphill, hitting Red. Dillinger helps Red up, and they continue. Winstead resumes tracking them. Dillinger confronts a man outside a cabin. Later, Red clutches his side, and Dillinger opens the stolen car's door for him. Baby Face reaches an unpaved road, where Baum, driving, peers ahead. Baby Face turns his back to the car, waves low, and keeps his Tommy gun hidden. Baum stops and exits. Baby Face throws him down, tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat, and drives off. Purvis runs through the forest, finds his fallen partner, doffs his hat, crouches by him, and watches the car drive away. Agent Madala hesitates upon seeing Baum's body. On the dirt road, Purvis aims at an oncoming car while signaling; it's Cowley's team. Cowley turns around, and Purvis rides on the passenger side running board, armed. Baby Face meets Homer and Shouse, who aim at the Ford as Cowley's car speeds and Purvis scowls into the night. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road, then the stolen Ford climbing ahead, prompting Purvis to fire. Homer returns fire as Baby Face swerves, and Purvis fires relentlessly as they gain on Baby Face. Homer reloads, and a curve gives Purvis an angled shot. Shouse nervously wipes his nose as Purvis hits the Ford's hood, causing it to crash into a field and roll twice before stopping. Shouse's lifeless face leans on the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed door, but the gangster kicks it out. Purvis arrives and shoots Homer, with redness erupting from his chest. Baby Face shoots Cowley, leading Purvis to aim with a pistol, but Agent Madala fires first. Purvis follows with his own shots, and the gangster goes down as Baby Face half recovers, gets to his knees, and fires rounds.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Dillinger scans the hillside, finding no one, as Red peers over his shoulder. Dillinger relaxes, and they move while Winstead hides. In slow motion, the criminals run along the misty overlook with Red leading as Agent Hurt fires, hitting Red. Dillinger helps Red up, and they continue. Winstead resumes tracking them. Dillinger confronts a man outside a cabin. Later, Red clutches his side, and Dillinger opens the car door for him. Baby Face reaches an unpaved road, where Baum drives and peers ahead. Baby Face waves low, paces backward, and hides his Tommy gun. Baum stops, and Baby Face throws him down, takes his gun, and drives off. Purvis finds Baum, doffs his hat, and moves out. Agent Madala hesitates at Baum's body. On the road, Purvis aims at an oncoming car; it's Cowley's team. Cowley turns, and Purvis rides outside, armed. Baby Face meets Homer and Shouse, who aim at Cowley's car. Purvis fires as the car follows a curve. Their headlights reveal the stolen Ford, prompting Purvis to fire. Homer returns fire, and Purvis fires relentlessly. Homer loads, and Purvis tags the Ford's hood, causing it to crash. Shouse's lifeless face leans on the windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck, but he kicks the door out. Purvis arrives and shoots Homer. Baby Face hits Cowley, leading Purvis to aim, but Madala fires first. Purvis follows up, and Baby Face goes down, half recovers, and fires Tommy rounds.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Dillinger carefully scans the hillside, searching intently for any sign of movement or presence, but he finds no indication of anyone nearby. Meanwhile, Red, who is perched in a tree, peers over Dillinger's shoulder, observing the scene. With no immediate threat in sight, Dillinger relaxes his aim, and both men begin to move forward. Winstead, however, remains hidden, lying low behind a tree, watching the events unfold. In a dramatic slow-motion sequence, the criminals make their way along the misty overlook, with Red taking the lead. Suddenly, Agent Hurt, positioned uphill, opens fire, and Red is brought down. Dillinger quickly urges Red to get back on his feet, and they continue their escape. Behind them, Winstead resumes his pursuit, tracking the pair with determination. Dillinger then confronts an average-looking man who is standing outside a cabin. Later, Red, clutching his side in pain, is helped by Dillinger, who opens the door of the car they had previously heisted. Meanwhile, Baby Face reaches an unpaved road, where Baum, who is driving a car, peers intently ahead over the steering wheel. As the vehicle's glaring headlights draw closer, Baby Face turns his back to it, waves a hand low, paces backward, and keeps his Tommy gun concealed under his coat. Baum brings the car to a stop and climbs out through the other door. In a swift move, Baby Face throws Baum down and tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat before getting behind the wheel himself. As Baum's car drives off into the distance, Purvis comes running through the forest, finding his fallen partner. He doffs his hat, crouches down beside his fading colleague, glaring after the car that is steadily riding away, and then moves out. Agent Madala follows, hesitating momentarily upon seeing Baum's lifeless body. On the dirt road, Purvis aims loosely at an oncoming car while holding up one hand; it turns out to be Cowley's team. Cowley executes a sharp 180-degree turn, and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board, armed with his Tommy gun. Baby Face soon encounters Homer and Shouse, who aim their guns at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn. Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road, and then they spot the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther ahead, prompting Purvis to open fire. Homer returns fire as Baby Face swerves to avoid the incoming shots, and Purvis fires relentlessly from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer quickly loads his next round, with a curve in the road providing Purvis an angled shot. Shouse, feeling nervous, wipes his nose as Purvis tags the Ford's hood, causing the Ford to careen into a field and roll over twice before finally settling on its tires. Shouse's lifeless face leans against the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed front door, but the paunchy gangster manages to kick it out. Purvis arrives on the scene and riddles Homer with bullets, with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. In a desperate attempt to escape, Baby Face manages to shoot Cowley, leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol, but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first. Purvis follows up with shots of his own, and the paunchy gangster goes down. As Baby Face half recovers, he gets to his knees and discharges rounds from his Tommy gun.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Dillinger cautiously and meticulously scans the hillside, his eyes searching intently for any sign of movement or presence, but unfortunately, he finds no indication of anyone nearby. Meanwhile, Red, who is strategically perched in a tree, peers over Dillinger's shoulder, carefully observing the entire scene. With no immediate threat in sight, Dillinger gradually relaxes his aim, and both men begin to move forward. Winstead, however, remains hidden and lies low behind a large tree, vigilantly watching the events as they unfold. In a dramatic, slow-motion sequence, the criminals make their way along the misty overlook, with Red confidently taking the lead. Suddenly, Agent Hurt, who is positioned uphill, opens fire, and Red is abruptly brought down. Dillinger quickly urges Red to get back on his feet, and they continue their escape. Behind them, Winstead resumes his relentless pursuit, tracking the pair with unwavering determination. Dillinger then confronts an average-looking man who is standing outside a cabin. Later, Red, clutching his side in visible pain, is helped by Dillinger, who opens the door of the car they had previously heisted. Meanwhile, Baby Face reaches an unpaved road, where Baum, who is driving a car, peers intently ahead over the steering wheel. As the vehicle's glaring headlights draw ominously closer, Baby Face turns his back to it, waves a hand low, paces backward, and keeps his Tommy gun slyly concealed under his coat. Baum brings the car to a stop and climbs out through the other door. In a swift and decisive move, Baby Face throws Baum down and tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat before getting behind the wheel himself. As Baum's car speeds off into the distance, Purvis comes running through the forest, finding his fallen partner. He doffs his hat, crouches down beside his fading colleague, glaring after the car that is steadily riding away, and then, with resolve, moves out. Agent Madala follows, hesitating momentarily upon seeing Baum's lifeless body. On the dirt road, Purvis aims loosely at an oncoming car while holding up one hand; it turns out to be Cowley's team. Cowley executes a sharp 180-degree turn, and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board, armed with his Tommy gun. Baby Face soon encounters Homer and Shouse, who aim their guns menacingly at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn. Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road, and then they spot the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther ahead, prompting Purvis to open fire. Homer returns fire as Baby Face swerves to avoid the incoming shots, and Purvis fires relentlessly from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer quickly loads his next round, with a curve in the road providing Purvis an angled shot. Shouse, feeling nervous, wipes his nose as Purvis tags the Ford's hood, causing the Ford to careen into a field and roll over twice before finally settling on its tires. Shouse's lifeless face leans against the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed front door, but the paunchy gangster manages to kick it out with effort. Purvis arrives on the scene and riddles Homer with bullets, with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. In a desperate attempt to escape, Baby Face manages to shoot Cowley, leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol, but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first. Purvis follows up with shots of his own, and the paunchy gangster goes down. As Baby Face half recovers, he gets to his knees and discharges rounds from his Tommy gun.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Dillinger carefully scans the hillside, his eyes moving methodically over the landscape, but he finds no sign of anyone. Meanwhile, Red, perched in a tree, leans forward to peer over Dillinger's shoulder, sharing in the search. With no immediate threat in sight, Dillinger relaxes his aim, lowering his weapon slightly, and both men begin to move away from their position. As they start off, Winstead remains hidden, lying low behind a tree, observing their movements. In a dramatic shift to slow motion, the criminals sprint along the misty overlook, with Red taking the lead, his movements deliberate and cautious. Suddenly, Agent Hurt, positioned uphill, opens fire, the sound of gunshots echoing through the air, and Red is struck, collapsing to the ground. Dillinger quickly rushes to Red's side, urging him to his feet with a sense of urgency, and together they continue their escape. Behind them, Winstead resumes his pursuit, tracking the pair with determined focus. As they make their way, Dillinger confronts an unsuspecting man standing outside a cabin, his demeanor assertive and commanding. Later, Red, visibly in pain, clutches his side, and Dillinger, showing a moment of concern, opens the door of the heisted car for him, helping him inside. Meanwhile, Baby Face reaches an unpaved road, where Baum, driving a car, peers intently over the steering wheel, scanning the road ahead. Baby Face, with a calculated move, turns his back to the approaching vehicle, the glaring headlights illuminating his figure. He waves a hand low, signaling, and paces backward cautiously, keeping his Tommy gun concealed under his coat. As Baum brings the car to a stop, he exits through the other door, only to be overpowered by Baby Face, who throws him down with force. Baby Face then tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat, quickly sliding behind the wheel and taking control of the vehicle. As Baum's car speeds away, Purvis comes running through the forest, his breath heavy and determined. He finds his fallen partner, Baum, and in a moment of respect and sorrow, doffs his hat, crouching down beside his fading colleague. His eyes follow the car as it rides steadily away, and with a renewed sense of purpose, he moves out. Agent Madala follows closely, hesitating momentarily upon seeing Baum's lifeless body, a look of shock and hesitation crossing his face. On the dirt road, Purvis, with a sense of urgency, aims loosely at an oncoming car while raising one hand in a signal; it's Cowley's team arriving. Cowley executes a sharp 180-degree turn, and Purvis, with agility and determination, rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board, his Tommy gun at the ready. Baby Face soon encounters Homer and Shouse, who stand ready, aiming their guns at the approaching Ford. As Cowley's car speeds forward, taking a tight turn, Purvis scowls into the night, his focus unwavering as the car follows another curve. Their headlights sweep over the road, revealing a dip ahead, and then the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther in the distance, prompting Purvis to open fire. Homer responds with gunfire of his own as Baby Face skillfully swerves to avoid the incoming shots. Purvis, relentless in his pursuit, continues firing from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer quickly loads his next round, the curve in the road providing Purvis with an angled shot. Shouse, visibly nervous, wipes his nose as Purvis's bullets find their mark, tagging the Ford's hood. The impact causes the Ford to veer off course, careening into a field and rolling twice before coming to a rest on its tires. Inside, Shouse's lifeless face leans against the cracked windshield, a haunting image of the chaos. Homer, seeing Baby Face trapped behind the jammed front door, makes a quick decision to leave him, but the paunchy gangster, with a burst of strength, kicks the door out. Purvis arrives on the scene, his gun blazing as he riddles Homer with bullets, each shot sending puffs of redness erupting from the gangster’s chest. In the midst of the chaos, Baby Face attempts to make an escape, managing to shoot Cowley, which prompts Purvis to take aim with his pistol. However, Agent Madala, acting swiftly, fires a shotgun first, the blast echoing through the air. Purvis follows up with shots of his own, and the paunchy gangster goes down, his body hitting the ground. Baby Face, half recovering from the chaos, struggles to his knees and, with a final act of defiance, discharges rounds from his Tommy gun.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Dillinger scans the hillside for any signs of life, with Red observing from his tree. As Dillinger relaxes his aim, they both move forward while Winstead remains hidden. In slow motion, the criminals run along the misty overlook, led by Red, until Agent Hurt fires from uphill, hitting Red. Dillinger helps Red up, and they continue on, with Winstead resuming his pursuit. Dillinger confronts a man outside a cabin, and later, he assists Red into a stolen car. Meanwhile, Baby Face reaches an unpaved road as Baum approaches in a car. Baby Face signals Baum to stop, then overpowers him, seizing his Tommy gun and taking the car. As Baum's car departs, Purvis arrives, finds his fallen partner, and moves on, with Agent Madala hesitating at Baum's body. On the dirt road, Purvis signals an oncoming car, which turns out to be Cowley's team. Cowley makes a sharp turn, and Purvis rides on the running board, armed with a Tommy gun. Baby Face encounters Homer and Shouse, who aim at Cowley's speeding car. Purvis fires as they approach a dip in the road, revealing the stolen Ford ahead. Homer returns fire, and Baby Face swerves to avoid shots. Purvis continues firing, hitting the Ford's hood, causing it to crash into a field and roll. Shouse is killed, and Homer leaves Baby Face trapped behind a jammed door, which he kicks open. Purvis arrives and shoots Homer, while Baby Face shoots Cowley. Purvis aims with a pistol, but Agent Madala fires first, followed by Purvis, bringing down the paunchy gangster. Baby Face attempts to recover, firing his Tommy gun from his knees.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Dillinger, the infamous bank robber whose escapades during the Great Depression made him a folk hero and an FBI target, scans the hillside but finds no sign of anyone, as Red, another member of the notorious gang, peers over his shoulder from his tree. Dillinger relaxes his aim, and both men start off while Winstead, an agent known for his role in the capture of criminals during this era, lies low behind a tree. In slow motion, the criminals run along the misty overlook with Red leading the way as Agent Hurt, an operative renowned for his sharpshooting skills, opens fire from uphill, bringing Red down. Dillinger urgently urges Red to his feet, and they move on. Behind them, Winstead resumes tracking the pair with the persistence he's famous for. Dillinger accosts an average man standing outside a cabin, a typical secluded dwelling in rural America during the 1930s. Later, Red clutches his side, wounded, and Dillinger opens the heisted car's door for him. Baby Face, a moniker for Lester Joseph Gillis known for his youthful appearance and vicious crimes, reaches an unpaved road, where Baum, driving a car, peers ahead over the steering wheel. Baby Face, notorious for his lethal confrontations with law enforcement, turns his back to the vehicle as its glaring headlights draw closer and waves a hand low, paces backward, and keeps his Tommy gun, an automatic weapon favored by gangsters of the time, under his coat. Baum stops and climbs out the other door. Baby Face, in a move characteristic of his audacious tactics, throws him down and tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat before getting behind the wheel. As Baum's car drives off, Purvis, the dedicated lead agent responsible for chasing many criminals of this era, comes running through the forest, finds his fallen partner, doffs his hat, crouches down to his fading colleague, a gesture of solemn respect, glaring after the car riding steadily away, and moves out. Agent Madala follows, hesitating upon seeing Baum's body, reflecting the grim realities faced by law enforcement officers. On the dirt road, Purvis aims loosely at an oncoming car while holding up one hand; it's Cowley's team, a group of agents organized to combat organized crime. Cowley pulls a 180, a maneuver executed to pursue fleeing gangsters quickly, and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board, armed with his Tommy gun, ready to engage in another shootout. Baby Face comes upon Homer and Shouse, fellow criminals who aim their guns at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn, and Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road, then the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther ahead, prompting Purvis to fire. Homer, a notorious gunman of the gang, returns fire as Baby Face swerves to avoid incoming shots, and Purvis fires relentlessly from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer loads his next round, with a curve in the road giving Purvis an angled shot. Shouse nervously wipes his nose, revealing the often tense and high-pressure state of gangsters on the run, as Purvis tags the Ford's hood, causing the Ford to careen into a field and roll twice before settling on its tires. Shouse's lifeless face leans on the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed front door, but the paunchy gangster kicks it out using the brute force often associated with survival instincts in gang wars. Purvis arrives and riddles Homer with bullets, with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest, a brutal reminder of the violent end met by many criminals. Making an escape, Baby Face nails Cowley, leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol, but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first, demonstrating the tactical teamwork that agents employed. Purvis follows up with shots of his own, and the paunchy gangster goes down as Baby Face half recovers, getting to his knees and discharges Tommy rounds, in a desperate final stand that marked the tragic ends of many notorious gangsters of the time.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Dillinger scans the hillside but finds no sign of anyone as Red peers over his shoulder from his tree. Dillinger relaxes his aim and both men start off while Winstead lies low behind a tree. In slow motion the criminals run along the misty overlook with Red leading the way as Agent Hurt opens fire from uphill bringing Red down. Dillinger urges Red to his feet and they move on. Behind them. Winstead resumes tracking the pair. Dillinger accosts an average man standing outside a cabin. Later Red clutches his side and Dillinger opens the heisted car's door for him. Baby Face reaches an unpaved road where Baum driving a car peers ahead over the steering wheel. Baby Face turns his back to the vehicle as its glaring headlights draw closer and waves a hand low paces backward and keeps his Tommy gun under his coat. Baum stops and climbs out the other door. Baby Face throws him down and tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat before getting behind the wheel. As Baum's car drives off Purvis comes running through the forest finds his fallen partner doffs his hat crouches down to his fading colleague glaring after the car riding steadily away and moves out. Agent Madala follows hesitating upon seeing Baum's body. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. On the dirt road Purvis aims loosely at an oncoming car while holding up one hand. it is Cowley's team. Cowley pulls a 180 and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board armed with his Tommy gun. Baby Face comes upon Homer and Shouse who aim their guns at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn and Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road. then the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther ahead prompting Purvis to fire. Homer returns fire as Baby Face swerves to avoid incoming shots and Purvis fires relentlessly from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer loads his next round with a curve in the road giving Purvis an angled shot. Shouse nervously wipes his nose as Purvis tags the Ford's hood causing the Ford to careen into a field and roll twice before settling on its tires. Shouse's lifeless face leans on the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed front door but the paunchy gangster kicks it out. Purvis arrives and riddles Homer with bullets with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. Making an escape Baby Face nails Cowley leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first. Purvis follows up with shots of his own and the paunchy gangster goes down as Baby Face half recovers getting to his knees and discharges Tommy rounds.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Dillinger scans the hillside but finds no sign of anyone as Red peers over his shoulder from his tree. Dillinger relaxes his aim and both men start off while Winstead lies low behind a tree. In slow motion the criminals run along the misty overlook with Red leading the way as Agent Hurt opens fire from uphill bringing Red down. Dillinger urges Red to his feet and they move on. Behind them. Winstead resumes tracking the pair. Dillinger accosts an average man standing outside a cabin. Later Red clutches his side and Dillinger opens the heisted car's door for him. Baby Face reaches an unpaved road where Baum driving a car peers ahead over the steering wheel. Baby Face turns his back to the vehicle as its glaring headlights draw closer and waves a hand low paces backward and keeps his Tommy gun under his coat. Baum stops and climbs out the other door. Baby Face throws him down and tosses Baum's Tommy gun onto the front seat before getting behind the wheel. As Baum's car drives off Purvis comes running through the forest finds his fallen partner doffs his hat crouches down to his fading colleague glaring after the car riding steadily away and moves out. Agent Madala follows hesitating upon seeing Baum's body. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. On the dirt road Purvis aims loosely at an oncoming car while holding up one hand. it is Cowley's team. Cowley pulls a 180 and Purvis rides outside the vehicle on the passenger side running board armed with his Tommy gun. Baby Face comes upon Homer and Shouse who aim their guns at the Ford as Cowley's speeding car takes a tight turn and Purvis scowls into the night as the car follows another curve. Their headlights reveal a dip in the road. then the stolen Ford climbing the rise farther ahead prompting Purvis to fire. Homer returns fire as Baby Face swerves to avoid incoming shots and Purvis fires relentlessly from Cowley's car as it gains on Baby Face. Homer loads his next round with a curve in the road giving Purvis an angled shot. Shouse nervously wipes his nose as Purvis tags the Ford's hood causing the Ford to careen into a field and roll twice before settling on its tires. Shouse's lifeless face leans on the cracked windshield. Homer leaves Baby Face stuck behind the jammed front door but the paunchy gangster kicks it out. Purvis arrives and riddles Homer with bullets with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. Making an escape Baby Face nails Cowley leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first. Purvis follows up with shots of his own and the paunchy gangster goes down as Baby Face half recovers getting to his knees and discharges Tommy rounds.

test_cases.description: Dillinger scans the hillside but finds no sign of anyone as Red peers over his shoulder from his tree. Dillinger relaxes his aim and both men start off while Winstead lies low behind a tree. In slow motion the criminals run along the misty overlook with Red leading the way as Agent Hurt opens fire from uphill bringing Red down. Purvis arrives and riddles Homer with bullets with puffs of redness erupting repeatedly from the gangster’s chest. Making an escape Baby Face nails Cowley leading Purvis to take aim with a pistol but Agent Madala fires a shotgun first. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Fluffy surveys the meadow but detects no trace of anybody, as Blue glances around her backpack from her cloud. Fluffy eases her stance, and both creatures skip along while Whiskers lies flat beside a rock. In normal speed, the wanderers hop along the sunny path with Blue hopping ahead as Investigator Thorn releases darts from downhill, bringing Blue to a halt. Fluffy beckons Blue to her paws, and they proceed. Behind them, Whiskers resumes following the duo. Fluffy confronts an unusual bird preening beside a nest. Later, Blue massages her ankle, and Fluffy unveils the borrowed wagon’s hatch for her. Little Paws arrives at a winding trail, where Sprout, pedaling a tricycle, squints forward over the handlebars. Little Paws faces away from the bicycle as its bright lanterns approach and waves a wing low, steps sideways, and keeps her violin inside her pouch. Sprout halts and leaps off the other pedal. Little Paws shoves Sprout aside and heaves Sprout's violin onto the back tire before hopping onto the handlebar. As Sprout’s bicycle rides away, Tracker dashes through the meadow, discovers her toppled companion, removes her glove, kneels beside her fading friend, glaring after the bicycle moving steadily away, and retreats. Investigator Luna follows, pausing upon noticing Sprout's frame. On the gravel path, Tracker aims loosely at an approaching bicycle while lifting one tentacle; it's Dandelion's crew. Dandelion executes a spin, and Tracker rides beside the bicycle on the frame’s ledge, equipped with her violin. Little Paws encounters Fuzzy and Freckle, who point their violins at the Toyota as Dandelion’s racing bicycle takes a sharp corner, and Tracker frowns in the moonlight as the bicycle rounds another bend. Their lanterns expose a dip in the trail, then the borrowed Toyota climbing the hill further away, prompting Tracker to play. Fuzzy plays back as Little Paws steers to avoid incoming tunes, and Tracker plays ceaselessly from Dandelion’s bicycle as it closes in on Little Paws. Fuzzy reloads her sheet music, with a bend in the road giving Tracker a tilted angle. Freckle hesitantly wipes her chin as Tracker marks the Toyota’s hood, causing the Toyota to tumble into a pasture and flip twice before resting on its wheels. Freckle's peaceful face leans on the shattered window. Fuzzy abandons Little Paws stuck behind the jammed rear hatch, but the stout artist pushes it open. Tracker arrives and peppers Fuzzy with melodies, with sprays of rhythm bursting repeatedly from the artist’s torso. Making a dash, Little Paws nabs Dandelion, prompting Tracker to aim with a flute, but Investigator Luna sounds a cello first. Tracker follows up with notes of her own, and the stout artist tumbles as Little Paws half recovers, rising to her feet and releases violin chords.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dillinger and Red attempt to escape along a misty overlook, but Agent Hurt shoots Red, prompting Dillinger to help him. As they flee, Winstead trails them. Dillinger confronts a man by a cabin, and later, they use a stolen car to move Red, who is wounded. Meanwhile, Baby Face encounters Baum on a road, disarming him and taking his car. Purvis finds Baum injured and angrily pursues the car. Agent Madala hesitates upon seeing Baum's body. Purvis and Cowley's team chase Baby Face, exchanging gunfire. During the pursuit, Purvis hits the Ford, causing it to crash. Shouse dies, and Homer tries to escape, but Purvis shoots him. Baby Face fights back, injuring Cowley, leading Purvis and Madala to fire, bringing Baby Face down after a brief recovery attempt.
